summary: Researchers often use animals to study disease, test product safety, experiment, or teach. Some uses cause animals pain or distress. Federal agencies require researchers to consider alternatives to animal use, such as computer modeling or working with cell cultures. The Department of Health and Human Services and other agencies have developed animal use alternatives and collaborate on these efforts in an interagency group. However, the...
title: Animal Use in Research: Federal Agencies Should Assess and Report on Their Efforts to Develop and Promote Alternatives
